clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Toric Intraocular Lens to Neutralize Keratometric Astigmatism
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Toric Intraocular Lens to Neutralize Keratometric Astigmatism

lead_sponsor.agency: Asociación para Evitar la Ceguera en México

clinical_study.source: Asociación para Evitar la Ceguera en México

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate neutralization of keratometric astigmatism in patients with cataract and astigmatism higher than 1 diopter, with phaco surgery and the implantation of a toric intraocular lens.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with Cataract are treated with phacoemulsification of the lens with an implantation of an intraocular lens. Besides cataract, almost 25% of these patients have some degree of Astigmatism; when it is higher than 1 diopter, it is possible to neutralize it with an implantation of a toric intraocular lens.

arm_group.description: A One piece, acrylic intraocular lens is implanted in the lens bag.

intervention.description: Cataract Surgery with a intraocular lens implantation
intervention.other_name: Acrysof Single Piece Natural Toric Lens. ALCON LABORATORIES INC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Symmetrical keratometric astigmatism ≥ 1.0 D and cataract.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Irregular astigmatism,
- Keratoconus,
- Previous Refractive Surgery.
